it.uniba.game.pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniba.game.pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Pawn

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class representing a generic chess piece
    Class type: < Entity >

    Responsibilities:
    Knows:
    • Which colors are used
    • The symbol (and so the color) of the instance of a Piece
    Does:
    • Generates a list of coordinates where a Piece could possibly be found, given the target position
    • Converts a Piece object into his symbol (in UTF-8)
    • Computes if two Pieces are equal
    • Can compute if a Piece had a target move out of bound
    Author:
    LeCun group

      Enumerated type used to represent the color of the piece

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(Piece.Color col)
        Constructor for the class Piece. It is applied in each sub-class constructor. It initializes the piece's color. If col==null then the set color is Color.WHITE.
        Parameters:
        col - color of the piece.

    • Method Detail

      • reverseMove

        public abstract java.util.LinkedList<it.uniba.game.Coordinates> reverseMove(Move target)
        Abstract method returning the list of possible starting position of a piece being moved given the Coordinates of its ending position, contained in target. If target's ending position is out of the chessboard bounds (from (0,0) to (7,7)), then the returned list is empty.
        Parameters:
        target - The piece's move, which starting position has to be determined.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList of Coordinates of the possible starting positions

      • getColor

        public Piece.Color getColor()
        Gets the color of the piece.
        Returns:
        this piece's color.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Piece class' toString method
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string containing the piece's symbol, assuming it is different for each color.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object toCompare)
        Piece class' equals method
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        toCompare - the piece that has to be compared with "this"
        Returns:
        true if the two pieces have the same symbol (since it identifies the piece's type), false otherwise
